title: Multi-layered web embedding
content: I've seen CSS tricks being used to create offset layered headlines, usually for a drop shadow. Has anyone seen an example of embedded web fonts being used with [multi-layered fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223041/http:/www.typodermic.com/139.html) to create a multicolored effect?
author: typodermic

comments.content: Check out [Brutal Exchange of a Smug for Some Faith](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223041/http:/www.afrojet.com/brutal/) by afrojet.
I wonder why the linking doesn't work in Chrome. Does it work in other browsers?

Works in Safari and Firefox on my Mac.

Maybe Chrome is doing some sort of domain checking (the font path is specified as a full http address).
That's odd. Seems to have been a problem with the font file and not the code. Should be working now in Chrome.

Old news :-) I made this one in 1997...

[http://www.microsoft.com/typography/web/embedding/demos/5/about5.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223041/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/web/embedding/demos/5/about5.aspx "http://www.microsoft.com/typography/web/embedding/demos/5/about5.aspx")
It works in Chrome now, cheers.
